member.name: P:CefSharp.Wpf.IWpfWebBrowser.BackCommand
member.summary: Navigates to the previous page in the browser history. Will automatically be enabled/disabled depending on the browser state.

member.name: P:CefSharp.Wpf.IWpfWebBrowser.ForwardCommand
member.summary: Navigates to the next page in the browser history. Will automatically be enabled/disabled depending on the browser state.

member.name: P:CefSharp.Wpf.IWpfWebBrowser.ReloadCommand
member.summary: Reloads the content of the current page. Will automatically be enabled/disabled depending on the browser state.

member.name: P:CefSharp.Wpf.IWpfWebBrowser.PrintCommand
member.summary: Prints the current browser contents.

member.summary: Increases the zoom level.

member.name: P:CefSharp.Wpf.IWpfWebBrowser.ZoomOutCommand
member.summary: Decreases the zoom level.

member.summary: Resets the zoom level to the default. (100%)

member.name: P:CefSharp.Wpf.IWpfWebBrowser.ViewSourceCommand
member.summary: Opens up a new program window (using the default text editor) where the source code of the currently displayed web page is shown.

member.name: E:CefSharp.Wpf.ChromiumWebBrowser.Rendering
member.summary: Raised before each render cycle, and allows you to adjust the bitmap before it's rendered/applied

member.name: P:CefSharp.Wpf.ChromiumWebBrowser.ZoomLevelIncrement
member.summary: Specifies the amount used to increase/decrease to ZoomLevel by By Default this value is 0.10

member.name: P:CefSharp.Wpf.ChromiumWebBrowser.CleanupElement
member.summary: The CleanupElement Controls when the BrowserResources will be cleand up. The ChromiumWebBrowser will register on Unloaded of the provided Element and dispose all resources when that handler is called. By default the cleanup element is the Window that contains the ChromiumWebBrowser. if you want cleanup to happen earlier provide another FrameworkElement. Be aware that this Control is not usable anymore after cleanup is done.

member.name: T:CefSharp.Wpf.RenderingEventArgs
member.summary: Event arguments to the Rendering event handler set up in IWebBrowser.

member.name: P:CefSharp.Wpf.RenderingEventArgs.BitmapInfo
member.summary: The bitmap info being rendered.

member.name: F:CefSharp.Wpf.WM.KEYDOWN
member.summary: The WM_KEYDOWN message is posted to the window with the keyboard focus when a nonsystem key is pressed. A nonsystem key is a key that is pressed when the ALT key is not pressed.

member.name: F:CefSharp.Wpf.WM.KEYUP
member.summary: The WM_KEYUP message is posted to the window with the keyboard focus when a nonsystem key is released. A nonsystem key is a key that is pressed when the ALT key is not pressed, or a keyboard key that is pressed when a window has the keyboard focus.

member.name: F:CefSharp.Wpf.WM.CHAR
member.summary: The WM_CHAR message is posted to the window with the keyboard focus when a WM_KEYDOWN message is translated by the TranslateMessage function. The WM_CHAR message contains the character code of the key that was pressed.

member.name: F:CefSharp.Wpf.WM.SYSKEYDOWN
member.summary: The WM_SYSKEYDOWN message is posted to the window with the keyboard focus when the user presses the F10 key (which activates the menu bar) or holds down the ALT key and then presses another key. It also occurs when no window currently has the keyboard focus; in this case, the WM_SYSKEYDOWN message is sent to the active window. The window that receives the message can distinguish between these two contexts by checking the context code in the lParam parameter.

member.name: F:CefSharp.Wpf.WM.SYSKEYUP
member.summary: The WM_SYSKEYUP message is posted to the window with the keyboard focus when the user releases a key that was pressed while the ALT key was held down. It also occurs when no window currently has the keyboard focus; in this case, the WM_SYSKEYUP message is sent to the active window. The window that receives the message can distinguish between these two contexts by checking the context code in the lParam parameter.

member.name: F:CefSharp.Wpf.WM.SYSCHAR
member.summary: The WM_SYSCHAR message is posted to the window with the keyboard focus when a WM_SYSKEYDOWN message is translated by the TranslateMessage function. It specifies the character code of a system character key â€” that is, a character key that is pressed while the ALT key is down.

member.name: F:CefSharp.Wpf.WM.IME_CHAR
member.summary: Sent to an application when the IME gets a character of the conversion result. A window receives this message through its WindowProc function.
